column4: Is there a way to use a port for something diffrent? I need a certain port, but it's already in use.
Is there a way to use a port for something different? I need a certain port, but it's already in use.
Jack_sparrow, it's a small .exe server under Wine, that you've probably never heard of.
Ok, is it possible to cancel use of a port, so nothing is using it, then use it for my own thing? (root user of course)
try « sudo netstat -nap | grep 666 » The last field should be the pid/name of the process using that port
so this: sudo netstat -nap | grep 666 winedevice.exe    ?
the process using port 666 is winedevice.exe?
Wineserver.exe is the process that I want to use with 666

the netstat command lists all ports that are currently used. With -nap, it also lists which processes are using them. I understood it as such that your program didn't work because that port was already in use?
then the following should list the process (last field) which is using it. « netstat -nap | grep 666 »
no, exactly as I typed it: netstat -nap | grep 666
it should show you the pid and the name of the process using it now. With that information you can kill that process so that the port is freed up for your own program.
